measure.CatchLine: Applies to cities that have a population of 50,000 or less.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Digest: The Act would reduce the number of hours that a notice must be posted before homeless people may be removed from an established camping site. The Act would say when property left behind shall be disposed of or collected. The Act would apply only to small cities. (Flesch Readability Score: 68.5). 
	Applies to cities that have a population of 50,000 or less. Reduces the number of hours that notice must be posted before removing homeless individuals from an established camping site. Provides circumstances in which property left at an established camping site after the notice period shall be disposed of or collected. 
	Declares an emergency, effective on passage.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to homeless camps; creating new provisions; amending ORS 195.505 and 195.530; and declaring an emergency.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to homeless camps; declaring an emergency.
measure.FiscalImpact: May have fiscal impact, but no statement yet issued
measure.RevenueImpact: May have revenue impact, but no statement yet issued

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
